column1: Domènec Torrent Font (born 14 July 1962) is a Spanish professional football manager and former player
column2: who is the current manager of Brazilian club Flamengo.

column1: Born in Santa Coloma de Farners
column4: Torrent played as a midfielder. He joined UE Olot in 1980 from hometown side CE Farners; Olot paid for his transfer by arranging a friendly against his former club. He left Olot in 1983
column6: where he retired at the age of just 27 to become a coach.

column1: Torrent started his coaching career in 1991 with hometown side CE Farners
column2: and led the club to a promotion to Regional Preferente (sixth tier) in 1994. He announced that he would leave the club in May 1996
column3: and subsequently took over UD Cassà also in the sixth level in July. In July 1997
column4: Torrent was appointed in charge of AE Roses
column5: still in division six. He offered his resignation in November
column6: which was refused by the club's board
column7: but was still sacked the following January.In May 1998
column8: Torrent was named manager of FC Palafrugell in the Primera Catalana; with the side he achieved promotion to Tercera División in 2000
column9: and led the club to a sixth position in the 2001–02 campaign
column10: the best of their history. In July 2003
column11: Torrent was appointed manager of Segunda División B side Palamós
column12: but suffered relegation at the end of the season; he subsequently left the club the following May. On 29 March 2005
column13: he was named manager of fellow third division strugglers Girona FC
column15: but was unable to avoid the drop.

column3: Torrent joined Pep Guardiola's staff at FC Barcelona B
column4: initially to work in as a tactical analyst. After the promotion to the third division and Guardiola's subsequent appointment as manager of the first team in May 2008
column5: Torrent also went up to the first team under the same role. Torrent remained with Guardiola as the latter moved to FC Bayern Munich and Manchester City
column6: winning 24 trophies in eleven years together.

column2: citing a desire to return to head coaching
column3: Torrent was named the new head coach at Major League Soccer side New York City FC
column4: replacing Patrick Vieira. He signed a three year contract through the 2020 season. His first professional match occurred on 24 June
column5: as NYCFC defeated Toronto FC by 2–1.On 8 November 2019
column6: New York City FC and Torrent mutually agreed to part ways. He left the club after achieving a franchise record 64 points in the 2019 campaign
column7: also qualifying for the ensuing CONCACAF Champions League.

column2: Torrent was named in charge of Campeonato Brasileiro Série A side Flamengo after agreeing to a one-and-a-half-year contract.

column1: Torrent is the grandson of a former Barcelona player.
